step1.sentence: Good therapists are trained to listen actively rather than waiting for their turn to speak.

step2.story: He had always thought he was a good listener, until he took a communication workshop and was asked to summarize what the previous speaker had said. He had retained almost nothing. He had been present, nodding, looking attentive. He had not been listening actively — he had been performing listening.

step3.story: The community forum had been designed for residents to give input on the proposed transit plan. The transit authority had listened passively for years — holding meetings, collecting comment cards, and largely proceeding with plans already made. This time, the project lead required every staff member present to listen actively — to take notes, to reflect what they heard back to the speaker, and to ask follow-up questions. Three decisions the transit authority had considered settled were reopened based on what emerged. The process took longer. The resulting plan required fewer revisions after approval.
